title: A Rainy Day in 1923
author: Eleanor Smith
content: Today the rain fell without pause. I watched the droplets race down the window pane as Mother read aloud by the fire. The world felt small and safe, wrapped in the sound of the storm.

title: Letter to My Dearest Friend
author: Thomas W. Clarke
content:
Dearest Margaret,

The war is nearly over, they say. I long for the day I may return and see your smile again. Until then, I hold your last letter close to my heart.

Yours,
Thomas

title: Reflections by the Lake
author: Anna Lee
content: The lake was still this morning, a perfect mirror for the sky. I sat beneath the old willow and wrote poems in my notebook. Sometimes, I think the world is made of memories and water.

title: First Day at School
author: Samuel Green
content: I wore my best shoes and a new cap. The teacher, Miss Carter, smiled kindly. I was nervous, but by lunchtime, I had made a friend named Peter. We traded marbles and stories.

title: Letter from the Trenches
author: James H. Miller
content:
My dearest Emily,

The mud is thick and the nights are cold, but thoughts of home keep me warm. I hope this letter finds you in good health. I dream of your apple pie and laughter.

With love,
James

title: A Letter to Father
author: Lucy Bennett
content:
Dear Father,

I planted the seeds you sent, and already the first shoots are showing. The village is quiet, but we all do our part. I miss your stories at bedtime.

Your loving daughter,
Lucy

title: Letter Across the Sea
author: Haruto Sato
content:
Dearest Mother,

The voyage is long, but the ocean is beautiful. I have met people from many lands. I will write again when we reach San Francisco.

With affection,
Haruto
